title.value: EVALUATING THE INTER-OBSERVER VARIABILITY IN THE DELINEATION OF RECTAL LESIONS IN ENDOSCOPY IMAGES
title.justification: The title is directly taken from the paper's heading.
title.quote: EVALUATING THE INTER-OBSERVER VARIABILITY IN THE DELINEATION OF RECTAL LESIONS IN ENDOSCOPY IMAGES

extractions.description: This study aims to quantify the inter-observer variability associated with identifying and delineating rectal lesions in endoscopy images. The focus is on understanding the discrepancies between observers and utilizing deep learning models to standardize contouring processes.

type.justification: The study involves the analysis of actual endoscopy images and the application of machine learning models to assess observer variability.
type.quote: The goal of this study was to quantify the inter-observer variability associated with the task of identifying and delineating rectal lesions in endoscopy images.

name.justification: The research primarily deals with the imaging of rectal lesions and uses image data to analyze observer variability.
name.quote: To facilitate tumour localization, MRI-compatible metallic clips can be placed around the lesion during an endoscopy exam before the first treatment.

name.justification: The study involves using deep learning models like VoxelMorph and Resnet for analyzing medical imaging data.
name.quote: VoxelMorph, a deep deformable registration model, integrated the daily anatomical deformations between each CBCT and the planning CT.

name.justification: The context of the study is related to treating rectal lesions and cancers via radiotherapy, and analyzing variability in imaging for treatment planning.
name.quote: Accurate contouring of rectal tumours in planning images is essential to deliver precise radiation treatments.

name.justification: VoxelMorph is specifically mentioned as a deep deformable registration model used in the study.
name.quote: VoxelMorph, a deep deformable registration model, integrated the daily anatomical deformations between each CBCT and the planning CT.

is_contributed.justification: VoxelMorph is referenced as a tool used, not developed, in this study.
is_contributed.quote: VoxelMorph, a deep deformable registration model, integrated the daily anatomical deformations between each CBCT and the planning CT.

is_executed.justification: The model was used to integrate anatomical deformations in the study's analysis.
is_executed.quote: VoxelMorph, a deep deformable registration model, integrated the daily anatomical deformations between each CBCT and the planning CT.

is_compared.justification: There is no indication that VoxelMorph was compared against other models in this study.
is_compared.quote: VoxelMorph, a deep deformable registration model, integrated the daily anatomical deformations between each CBCT and the planning CT.

referenced_paper_title.justification: The paper does not provide a specific reference for VoxelMorph.

name.justification: Resnet is mentioned as a convolutional neural network model used in the study.
name.quote: Resnet, a convolutional neural network with multiple layers was trained using a 5 fold cross validation.

is_contributed.justification: Resnet is a well-known model and is utilized in this research without being a new contribution.
is_contributed.quote: Resnet, a convolutional neural network with multiple layers was trained using a 5 fold cross validation.

is_executed.justification: Resnet was executed as part of the study for classifying data.
is_executed.quote: Resnet, a convolutional neural network with multiple layers was trained using a 5 fold cross validation.

is_compared.justification: Its predictive performance was compared to a baseline model.
is_compared.quote: Its predictive performance was compared to the baseline model using only clinical data.

referenced_paper_title.justification: The paper does not provide a specific reference for Resnet.

name.value: Endoscopy Images of Rectal Cancer Patients
name.justification: The dataset consisting of endoscopy images from 24 rectal cancer patients is a key part of this study's analysis.
name.quote: Materials and Methods: Two radiation oncologists and one gastroenterologist identified tumours and treatment change in 801 endoscopy images from 24 rectal cancer patients undergoing radiotherapy.

referenced_paper_title.justification: The dataset is described within this study and not referenced from another paper.
referenced_paper_title.quote: Materials and Methods: Two radiation oncologists and one gastroenterologist identified tumours and treatment change in 801 endoscopy images from 24 rectal cancer patients undergoing radiotherapy.
